cast.name: 莫里斯·卡诺夫斯基 Morris Carnovsky

director.name: 威拉德·范戴克 Willard Van Dyke
拉尔夫·斯坦纳 Ralph Steiner

introduction: The City is a pioneering short documentary film from 1939 that contrasts the problems of the contemporary urban environment with the superior social and physical conditions that can be provided in a planned community. It was directed and photographed by Ralph Steiner and Willard Van Dyke based on a treatment by Lewis Mumford based on an outline by Pare Lorentz. Aaron Copland wrote the musical score and Morris Carnovsky provided the narration.
